message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using Migrant Stock Database generated by the United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs, we analyze the long-term effects of migration on regional productivity growth in developed countries.", "dataset": ["Migrant Stock Database", "United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs"], "topic": ["Migration", "Regional Integration"]}, {"sentence": "This research work examines the impact of environmental regulation on firm-level production efficiency using plant-level data from the Pollution Release and Transfer Register at Mexico's National Institute of Ecology and Climate Change and the Annual Industrial Survey database at the National Institute of Statistics and Geography.", "dataset": ["Pollution Release and Transfer Register", "Annual Industrial Survey database"], "topic": ["Environment", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "Drawing on the World Bank Enterprise Surveys, we uncover key obstacles to formalization and growth faced by small and medium-sized enterprises in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "Our paper combines satellite data from the Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission with microeconomic household surveys to study how families in Bolivia cope with droughts that occur during the El Niño–Southern Oscillation cycle.", "dataset": ["Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Disaster Risk Management", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This article studies the impacts of air pollution exposure on cognitive performance using a representative sample of China’s population that is tracked by the China Family Panel Studies dataset.", "dataset": ["China Family Panel Studies dataset"], "topic": ["Health", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the Colombian government’s Sistema General de Seguridad Social en Salud and from the International Classification of Disease to evaluate whether the provision of health insurance coverage reduces mortality rates among poor households.", "dataset": ["Sistema General de Seguridad Social en Salud", "International Classification of Disease"], "topic": ["Health", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "By examining the relationships between road transport facility structures, blockchain-based information systems, and efficiency measured in a dataset from Shanghai Yan'an Transportation Group, we analyze how blockchain can be applied to public transportation to improve service quality.", "dataset": ["dataset from Shanghai Yan'an Transportation Group"], "topic": ["Transport", "Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses data from the Demographic and Health Surveys conducted in Nigeria in 2018 and from user reviews on on-demand delivery platforms to examine how health-related on-demand delivery services affect the utilization of health facilities in Nigeria.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "By using rich administrative data from the Informal Economic Survey collected by the Mexico National Institute of Statistics and Geography, we investigate various aspects of informality and their determinants.", "dataset": ["Informal Economic Survey", "Mexico National Institute of Statistics and Geography"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This study analyzes the effectiveness of government-funded energy efficiency programs in China's manufacturing industry using firm-level data from the Annual Survey of Industrial Enterprises and energy consumption data from the China Industrial Energy Audit Database.", "dataset": ["Annual Survey of Industrial Enterprises", "China Industrial Energy Audit Database"], "topic": ["Energy", "Environment", "Governance"]}]
